html: One example of your narrow analysis: In rushing to endorse more walls, you failed to notice that families are presenting themselves *at* the wall, which isn’t built *on* the border, but yards/miles away. By the time families reach Border Patrol, they’re already *on* US soil.
text:
One example of your narrow analysis: 

In rushing to endorse more walls, you failed to notice that families are presenting themselves *at* the wall, which isn’t built *on* the border, but yards/miles away.

By the time families reach Border Patrol, they’re already *on* US soil.

html: - recognize there is a difference between asylum-seekers and those seeking to cause us harm; - use resources provided by Congress intelligently, humanely and effectively; - put our agents back on the front front lines and at our ports of entry so they can do their jobs;

It is my hope that the acting Secretary will: - work closely with border communities for humane strategies that follow our laws; - never engage in or advocate for government-sanctioned child abuse; - recognize *true* roots and causes of migration (hint: it’s not “loopholes”);

HHS’s Commander White said he started raising concerns about Trump’s plan to separate families at the border back in Feb. 2017. 

But HHS Secretary Azar testified today that he never even heard of the plan before it was announced publicly in April 2018.

How can that be?

.@RepEscobar “Will you request that list from DHS?”

[Pause]

Rep: “Wouldn’t it be incumbent on us to make sure that every single child that was separated could be accounted for? Isn’t that our obligation?”

White “That’s a matter that Judge Sabraw is deciding right now.”

html: White: If someone gave HHS a list of separated kids not included in the Ms. L class, "we could certainly tell you to whom we discharged every single one of those children.” @RepEscobar “Who can get you that list?” W: “We don’t have it in HHS. I would assume only DHS..."

text:
My darling, 
I write from the borderland of El Paso, where I find myself on the front lines of our great national emergency. Yesterday, a comrade bunkered nearby reported that canine feces had been abandoned on his property. I don’t know how much more I can endure. Pray for me.

She later breaks into tears, as fellow Dems come over to give hugs

text:
Hitting a wall over funding: 
1) Mexico will pay for it. 
2) trade deal will pay for it. 
3) shutdown over whether taxpayers will pay for it. 
4) next: courts decide if executive action can be used to pay for it

html: I immediately requested a visit, and was able to spend several hours this afternoon at the detention facility talking to personnel and to 6 detainees being force-fed, many of whom have been detained for 15-18 months.
text: I immediately requested a visit, and was able to spend several hours this afternoon at the detention facility talking to personnel and to 6 detainees being force-fed, many of whom have been detained for 15-18 months.

html: Like many, I was deeply alarmed by this report indicating that @ICEgov is force-feeding immigrants who are on hunger strike at the El Paso Processing Center.https://twitter.com/AP/status/1091093269461770242 …
